events.event_description: ERCOT recorded an all-time winter high for natural gas-fired electricity generation during a cold snap, reaching 49.4 gigawatts.
events.citation: Hourly natural gas-fired electricity generation increased to 49.4 gigawatts (GW) for the hour starting at 7:00 p.m. central time on January 16, 2024, 1% more than the previous winter record of 48.8 GW set on December 23, 2022

events.event_description: Texas electric power sector set a record for daily natural gas consumption at 8.6 billion cubic feet per day.
events.citation: On January 15, increased demand in Texas for electricity led to record daily natural gas consumption by the Texas electric power sector, 8.6 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d), a 0.1-Bcf/d increase over the previous record set on August 25, 2023

events.event_description: Natural gas-fired generation made up 56% of all generation in ERCOT during a three-day cold snap, compared to the January average of 46%.
events.citation: On a daily basis, natural gas-fired electricity generation made up 56% of all generation in ERCOT during the cold snap (January 14–16, 2024), compared with an average share of 46% for January 2024

events.event_description: Texas implemented weatherization standards requiring critical natural gas infrastructure to be protected against weather emergencies.
events.citation: Weatherization standards implemented in August 2022 following Winter Storm Uri required critical natural gas infrastructure, including pipelines servicing electricity generation facilities, to be protected against weather emergencies
